top_categories.workout_context: 80ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Gravel del Fuego's Chilean Patagonia, South American gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Gravel del Fuego, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel del Fuego's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel del Fuego. Train it until it feels boring.
8,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
8,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel del Fuego, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel del Fuego’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel del Fuego. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel del Fuego requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on patagonian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: chilean patagonia, south american gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 100 miles of patagonian mountain gravel in Patagonia, Chile.
